The underwater construction industry would see a significant boom, with new underwater hotels and resorts becoming popular destinations.
Aquatic life could become more accessible to humans, allowing for better conservation efforts and increased awareness of marine ecosystems.
Underwater sports and competitions would gain popularity, including underwater basketball, soccer, and even synchronized swimming.
The fishing industry would need to adapt, as humans would no longer rely on scuba gear to access deeper waters and catch fish.
Underwater agriculture would become a viable option, with farmers growing crops in submerged greenhouses or kelp farms.
